alert.note: Alert for San Miguel (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 04 at 7:58PM MDT until August 04 at 10:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL SAN MIGUEL COUNTY... At 758 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain ended across the warned area. However, up to 2 inches of rain fell earlier over Route 104 and the Conchas River above Conchas Canyon. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.15 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is likely ongoing. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Central San Miguel County This includes the following highways... State Road 104 between Mile Markers 12 and 26. Flash flooding is expected within and below Conchas Canyon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Both localized and distant heavy rainfall will create sudden and dangerous flows in arroyos and over low water crossings.
